answers.answer: Hello,I honestly do not believe that you could infect your father this way with anything.  I will answer your questions here below:Are my HIV results conclusive? YES, THEY ARE.Is there any risk i put my father in with the diabetes machine from what i explained? NO, I DO NOT THINK SO.How long should i keep doing the HIV antibody test for post-exposure?NO NEED TO HAVE ANY FURTHER TESTS FOR HIVSome people say do it for a year.  I'm confused... NO THAT IS NOT ACCURATE AT ALL.  YOUR NEGATIVE TEST AT 12 WEEKS IS FULLY CONCLUSIVEDoes Hep C coinfection delay HIV testing beyond 12 weeks?   NO, IT DOES NOTI'm somehow afraid i have HIV-2, is the window period the same as HIV-1 or should i keep testing for a year? YES, IT IS SAME WINDOW PERIOD.  HIV-2 IS MUCH MORE DIFFICULT TO TRANSMIT, THAT IS WHY IT IS SO RARE.Does Diabetes or fatty liver disease cause delayed HIV seroconversion past 3 months? NO, IT DOES NOT.Best wishes,Dr José

question: Hello Dr.,About 3 months ago i engaged in unprotected anal sex with a transgender (M2F) as a top. I got tested in the United States at a major hospital through my GP.   I've posted my test results below:9 weeks post exposure: HIV-1 RNA Pooled = Undectable10.5 weeks post exposure: HIV 1/2 Antibody = Non-Reactive7 weeks post exposure: HEP C Antibody negative12 weeks post exposure: HIV 1/2 Antibody = Non-ReactiveMy main concern is that, during the window i used my fathers Diabetes testing kit to check my sugar.  It was a reusable shooter where you just switch out the lancets (finger pricker) in the machine and then re-shoot.  I put a new lancet in the shooter then pricked myself and then removed the lancet from the shooter and threw it in the sharps container.  Now, I am concerned that i coudl have infected my father or got somethign from him by using the same shooter but installing a new lancet.Are my HIV results conclusive?Is there any risk i put my father in with the diabetes machine from what i explained?How long should i keep doing the HIV antibody test for post-exposure?  Some people say do it for a year.  I'm confused...Does Hep C coinfection delay HIV testing beyond 12 weeks?I'm somehow afraid i have HIV-2, is the window period the same as HIV-1 or should i keep testing for a year?Does Diabetes or fatty liver disease cause delayed HIV seroconversion past 3 months?thanks.
title: Risk from incident
